title: What is difference between On Page SEO and Off Page SEO?
content:
üîπ On-Page SEO = everything you do on your website to help it rank. Examples:

Optimizing titles, headings, and keywords

Writing quality content

Internal linking between your own pages

Image alt text and page speed improvements

üëâ Think of it like decorating and organizing your own shop so visitors (and Google) can easily understand what you offer.

üîπ Off-Page SEO = everything that happens outside your website to boost its authority and reputation. Examples:

Backlinks (other sites linking to you)

Social media engagement

Online mentions and reviews

Guest posting

üëâ Think of it like people recommending your shop to others, which makes it more trustworthy.

‚öñÔ∏è Which is more important? They work best together:

On-page SEO makes your site understandable.

Off-page SEO makes it credible.

title: Firefox icons on Windows11 taskbar
content:
I have a Firefox icon on my Windows11 desktop, Start, and one on the taskbar. If I click one either the Firefox icon on the desktop or Start I will get another icon on the task bar and I can do this over and over on my personal desktop getting many Firefox icons.

I just purchased a new Dell Windows11 desktop and have installed Firefox. I set it up just like my personal desktop and have icons on the desktop, Start, and taskbar but every time I click the Firefox desktop or Start icon I don't get a separate icon in the taskbar but they pile up behind the original Firefox on the taskbar. If the cursor hovers over the Firefox icon then I can see the multiple Firefox homepages that I generated.

I have searched for an answer to this problem but have been unsuccessful. I would really appreciate some thoughts on this issue. Firefox has been my one and only browser for many years and I love it 99% of the time, just not this one time. :-) Thank you in advance. Chuck Hall

title: Firefox 43.0.1 64-bit not saving cookies
content:
I've been trying to get Firefox to save cookies for a few desired websites (bank, investment accounts website, Sync... and of course Firefox/Mozilla itself) so I don't have to constantly use the 2FAs for those accounts. Firefox refuses to keep me logged in to my Mozilla/Firefox account. Every few hours -- or at the very least, after a machine shut-down -- I have to re-login if I re-start Firefox.

I do not use the Firefox Password Manager; it's unchecked in Settings. Nor do I use the Autofill options in Settings. I use the Bitwarden Extension (set to Never for locking/logout -- because this is a home computer) for Firefox to log in to my sites, with a separate authenticator app, Authy.

The Firefox Privacy & Security Settings for tracking cookie blocking are the Standard ones; I haven't done anything to customize them. Further down on that page, I've tried leaving the box blank for clearing cookies on exit. I've tried checking the box and setting up exceptions for those few sites I'd like to login to without having to go through the 2FA rigamarole. I've done multiple Refreshes, clearing of History, uninstall/reinstalls including deletion of every Firefox profile and anything hinting at a connection to Mozilla or Firefox in all Users on the computer, including all the AppData folders. A few days ago, I even deleted the Mozilla/Firefox account and set up a new one with a different email address.

Nothing seems to work. Most recently, Firefox still had all the relevant cookies after the computer was shut down overnight, but an hour into my day's work, after closing Firefox and re-opening it a short while later, all the cookies are gone once again!

None of this was an issue about three months ago. I could save the desired cookies, get rid of other ones, use private browsing, etc. etc., with basically the same set-up and with the Mozilla/Firefox account I had had for years. Now, I've had to delete that account in an apparently vain effort to try to clear out anything "Mozilla" from this computer -- and it didn't work anyhow.

(I posted about this same issue a week or so ago, but didn't receive any responses and have now deleted that Mozilla/Firefox account -- see above -- so this message is an update.)

title: How can I prevent the title bar from showing in macOS fullscreen?
content:
I am looking for a way to hide the title bar for Firefox while in Fullscreen mode on macOS. Currently it is quite bothersome when I go to click a tab and the title bar pops in and moves everything down. I often then move my cursor down and try to click on the tab, but by then the title bar hides and causes me to refresh the page or click the address bar.

This issue occurs when I already have 'Title Bar' disabled in my customization settings, which is odd because I expect this setting to hide the title bar entirely.

Chrome handles this nicely, where the Close, Minimize, and Expand/Collpase buttons are kept to the left of the tab bar, even in fullscreen mode. It seems Firefox also attempts this, but for some reason it only does this when it is not in fullscreen mode. It would be nice if firefox could maintain these buttons to the left of the tab bar, and prevent the title bar from showing entirely, when in fullscreen.

title: Why are many Firefox passwords showing the same ‚Äúlast used/updated‚Äù date, even for sites I didn‚Äôt visit?
content:
Could this be due to a Firefox update, extension (e.g. LastPass), or syncing?

I‚Äôve noticed in Firefox Password Manager that a large number of saved logins all show the same ‚Äúlast used/updated‚Äù date in the past (e.g. July 2020). This includes websites that I know I did not visit or log into at that time.

I am now in a situation where I‚Äôm being accused of attempting to access a site on that specific date, but I strongly believe I did not.

Can anyone clarify whether this behaviour could be explained by something like: 

- A Firefox update,

- The installation or update of a browser extension (such as LastPass), or

- A syncing/importing process that might change timestamps for multiple entries at once?

I‚Äôve attached screenshots from Firefox to show how this appears....there are LOTS of sites that have this date on them, not just the one that I am being accused of trying to access.

Any insight into why these ‚Äúused/updated‚Äù dates might change in bulk would be extremely helpful.

title: eesrchrdr.com
content:
Bonjour, lorsque je tape un mot dans la barre de recherche, le moteur de recherche google (qui est definit comme moteur de recherche par default) m'affiche les sites qu'il a trouv√©, et de suite apr√®s, la recherche se relance automatiquement avec une adresse https://eesrchrdr.com/... avant de basculer sur http://fr.search.yahoo.com/... et m'affiche les recherche effectu√© par yahoo. Je ne comprend pas pourquoi le moteur de recherche google qui est selectionn√© dans les parametres se fait automatiquement remplacer par yahoo.

Hello, When I type a word in the search bar, the Google search engine (which is set as the default search engine) shows me the sites it found, and immediately afterward, the search automatically restarts with the address https://eesrchrdr.com/... before switching to http://fr.search.yahoo.com/... and shows me the searches performed by Yahoo. I don't understand why the Google search engine selected in the settings is automatically replaced by Yahoo.

title: How to add film credit to Wikipedia article on Robert Berry
content:
I wish to add a film credit to the Wikipedia article on Robert Berry. In 1975 Robert Berry wrote and performed the music for The Milpitas Monster Movie released May 20th 1976. A 45 R.P.M Stereo Record was produced with Janell Records BMI SIDE 1 Milpitas Monster SIDE 2 Dining on the Dump. Robert's 10 sound on sound recordings also included theactric music themes throughout the entire movie, for The Monster, The Emergency Task Force, The Class Clowns, The Town Drunk, and a Music crescendo for Opening Title and Closing Credits. 

                                              Visit more at milpitasmonster.com                              ¬© PA 1-978-315 Effective Date of Registration September 08 2014.           The Director's Cut of the Milpitas Monster Previous Alternative Title: The Milpitas Monster.           ~ A filmed Interview of Robert Berry with Robert Burrill is within the DVD EXTRAS within 2-DVD-Set ~

The Milpitas Monster Movie Makers celebrate their 49th Annual screening Oct 26 at the Niles Essany Silent Film Museum Sunday at 1PM. The 50 year Anniversary is May 20th 2026 at The Milpitas Great Mall Cinemark Century Theaters. Additional 2026 screenings are July 4th & Oct 30th. 

                 We have a MP3 audio track of MILPITAS MONSTER available for upload.  Robert.Burrill@me.com

title: Firefox disables my internet connection
content:
Hi. I've been having trouble with Firefox.

When I enter a certain website (https://app.helpwise.io/) using my PC, after a few minutes my internet connection gets disabled. When I try to run 'Diagnose Network Problems' in Win11, no issues.

First time this happened, a restart fixed the problem. Second time, a DNS flush fixed it. But after that, those solutions don't work anymore.

I initially thought it was that website (which I use for work) but I tried running that website on my Android phone using Firefox as well and I did not have any connectivity issues.

So, I tried running the website in Chrome - no issues. I did work side by side with Firefox opened as all my bookmarks for work are there, and eventually after a few hours my internet was disconnected again - even though https://app.helpwise.io/ was not opened in Firefox.

I have tried refreshing Firefox, then disabling all extensions and running https://app.helpwise.io/ and still it immediately disabled my internet.

There are some times that it even turned OFF my Avast anti-virus.

I have tried running Avast and Malwarebytes and no virus or malware was detected.

I still want to use Firefox and I'm now thinking of formatting my computer. But when I run Firefox again after formatting, I may have the same issue.

Can anyone help?
creator: eduforonda

title: How to restore my tabs on my initialized laptop

All my previous Shortcuts and Bookmarks are all fine.

How do I restore the previous tabs?

title: Vertical Tab Groups
content: I use vertical tabs and the new tab group feature which allows you to assign a group heading for 1 or more tabs. When I right click on a tab I can create a new tab group. Below this option is a button labeled "Closed Groups". If I want to use one of these and check it, the tab I want to assign to it is closed and the group name is not listed in the sidebar. It seems the "Closed Groups" can no longer be used. There is no way to get rid of them and I end up creating duplicates as new tab groups with the same names. I want to either delete the Closed Groups or be able to reuse them. Any solution for this problem?
